meanings.definition: To make (bacteria) more susceptible to phagocytosis by coating them with opsonins.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was opsonizing the bacteria to help the immune system fight off the infection.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that opsonizing the bacteria would make them easier to destroy.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria felt like they were getting a fancy makeover when they were opsonized.
meanings.sent4: Opsonizing the bacteria was like putting a spotlight on them for the immune system to notice.
meanings.sent5: Opsonizing the bacteria was like giving them a bright target for the immune cells to attack.

meanings.definition: The process of coating bacteria with opsonins to enhance phagocytosis.
meanings.sent1: The opsonizing of the bacteria was crucial for the immune system to eliminate them.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the opsonizing of bacteria to understand how it boosts immune response.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria threw a party to celebrate their opsonizing, feeling extra special.
meanings.sent4: The opsonizing of bacteria acted like a magnet, attracting immune cells to devour them.
meanings.sent5: The opsonizing process made the bacteria stand out, making them an easy target for immune cells.
